intro: Hieracium strictipes, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, often blooming from June to August. Hieracium strictipes is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
